quote: I don't want any trouble,   Barlcay...
Trouble? Why would there be   trouble?
There's always trouble when you   come in here.
You're on duty, Lieutenant.
Is that a fact?
It is, and you'll observe it.   Get back to your post.
Look, pal. Do me a favor. Take   yourself and your holier-than-thou   attitude and get out of my life.
This is insubordination, Mister   Barclay.
So punish me.
Security to Ten-Forward!
"Insubordination."
Riker, you're nothing but a pretty   mannequin dressed up in a fancy   uniform. You're full of hot air,   and if Picard has a problem with   me, he can come and tell me   himself...
I feel your confidence, your   arrogant resolve. It excites me.
Lieutenant Barclay, report to   Cargo Bay Five now.
This will have to wait, darling.       Um... Be right there.       Freeze program. Exit.
Save program.

I just don't know what to do with   him. He's always late, never   gives his best effort, always   slides by... I can't deal with   it anymore. How does a guy like   him ever make it through the   Academy...
I think it's time we talked to   the captain about Broccoli.       That's what Wesley calls him.   Keep it to yourself.
It fits.
A broken seal, Commander.
You better destroy it. Those   samples will be tainted.
Is it a problem for you to report   to duty on time, Lieutenant?
Problem? Nossir. I'm... I'm very   sorry, sir... it's just... I had   a very important communique...   it required my immediate response   and...
I don't want to hear it... we're   having intermittent problems with   the anti-grav unit, see what you   can do...

Mister Barclay, I'm tired of   seeing your name on report.       I don't know what you got away   with on your last posting, but   this is the Enterprise. We set   a different standard here.   Understood?
Understood... sir.

Captain's log, Stardate 43807.4.   We are taking on a load of special   tissue samples donated by the   Mikulaks for shipment to Nahmi   Four. The samples could prove   vital to the containment of an   outbreak of Correllium Fever on   that world.
Everything looks... it looks   normal to me...
Dammit..
I... I don't understand...
La Forge to Engineering... I'll   need more people in Cargo Bay   Five... anyone you can spare.   Out.
We could use a hand, Mister   Barclay...
I'll... I'll disassemble it later,   Commander... it shouldn't do   that... well, of course, it   shouldn't do that... I mean...   well, it shouldn't do that.
I'm not accustomed to seeing an   unsatisfactory rating for one of   my crew.
I guess the issue is whether   Mister Barclay is Enterprise   material.
I assume from your request for   his transfer that you don't think   he is, Commander...
I hate to say it... I always   thought I could work with   anyone... but I just can't stand   the guy. Broccoli makes me   nervous... he makes everyone   nervous...
Broccoli?
Young Mister Crusher started it.   I'm afraid it's caught on.
Let's get it uncaught, shall we?

By all indications, Barclay has   served honorably in Starfleet for   many years. His rating aboard   the Zhukov was satisfactory...   I recall Captain Gleason speaking   quite highly of him before his   transfer...
In retrospect, I wonder if Captain   Gleason wasn't buttering our bread   a little...
He knew we were looking for a   diagnostic engineer.
I've reviewed Barclay's   psychological profile. He's   always had seclusive tendencies...   it was noted at the Academy more   than once...
And yet he chose this way of life;   he's made the same commitment to   Starfleet that we all have...       It's easy to transfer our problem   to someone else. Too easy.
Captain, it's not like I haven't   tried...
Try harder.
He's on your team. Manage him.   Pull him in. Find ways to help   him make a positive contribution.   Get to know the man. Make him   your best friend.
With all respect, sir... my best   friend? I can barely tolerate   being in the same room with the   man...
I suggest you put your personal   discomfort with him aside,   Commander. Dismissed.
My best friend.
Hey, Reg...
Uh, how's it going?
Oh, it's... I still haven't traced   the problem, Commander...
That's okay. No rush. Take your   time.
I've... I've been planning to run   diagnostics on the graviton   invertor circuits...
Smart plan... well, I'd say we're   in good hands here...
I'll get a preliminary report to   you...
...whenever.
Before the end of the day.
Fine. And say, Reg, how about   sitting in on the mission briefing   with my senior officers in the   morning...
The briefing? Me?
I'd just like your input...
On what? I mean, should I prepare   something...
No... no... just be there. Eight   hundred hours.
I'll be on time, sir.
Good.
Morning. Start your brains, and   let's do it.

(points to injectors     on schematic)   Okay, this trip to Nahmi Four is   pretty routine. We'll have plenty   of time to realign the magnetic   capacitors in both the matter and   anti-matter injectors.       Duffy, Costa, that'll be your   assignment.
We probably ought to do the flow   regulator maintenance at the same   time, Commander.

Good idea.       Ensign Crusher is putting in some   hours with us this week as part   of his training duties... he'll   be assigned to assist you, Mister   Myers. Be sure and teach him the   difference between impulse and   warp drive.       Lieutenant Barclay is working on   the mystery of the anti-grav   failure we had yesterday... your   preliminary report had a couple   of interesting theories, Reg...
Why don't you summarize your   findings so far, Reg...
Yes.       It wasn't a maintenance problem...   everything checked out. I...   I'm going to check for... a surge   in... the transfer coils.
A coil surge wouldn't have   resulted in a field dissipation.
I... I... I realize that...
(trying to rescue the     the situation)   But we shouldn't ignore the   possibility, Wes...
You ought to take a look at the   flow capacitor. That could   have forced a chain collapse of   the antigrav field.
I... was going to.
Good. Okay, then... let's go over   the realignment procedure...
I just didn't know what to say.
What do you wish you had said?
I should have told him to mind   his own damned business... I knew   about the flow capacitor... I   didn't need to hear about it from   a seventeen year old kid.
You're letting it get you much   too upset.
You think so?
Why are you so hard on yourself?
You don't know... it's hard out   there.
I understand, but let go of it.   You're here now.
You're right, of course.
Of course.
Let me help you relax.
I'd like that.
I knew you would.
Mmm, nice... but I'm in the mood   for someplace a little more...   unusual...       Computer. Run Barclay Program   Fifteen.
I am the Goddess of Empathy. Cast   off your inhibitions and embrace   love, truth, joy...
But I thought that's the point   of the briefing... to discuss   different approaches...
I'm not saying you did anything   wrong, Wes... it's just that   Barclay's... well, my new   project.
Yeah, Broccoli's a real project   all right...
I just gotta draw him out more...
And I shut him down.       Poor Broccoli.
Pardon me, but why is Lieutenant   Barclay being referred to   clandestinely as a vegetable?
It's a joke, Data... you know,   a nickname.
Nicknames generally denote   fondness, a diminutive shared   between friends. This does not   sound friendly.
Data's absolutely right. The   nickname stops here and now.   Captain's orders.
What the hell... ?
What happened to your glass?
Nucleo-synthesis. The structure   of the glass has been altered at   the atomic level.
A problem with the replicator?

Unlikely. A problem with the   replicator would have affected   the contents as well as the glass.   But the liquid in the glass was   a perfect replication of a dark   ale of Earth origin which I   believe is what Lieutenant Duffy   ordered.
I can't detect any residual   radiation or unusual chemical   compounds that would have caused   this.
The most probable explanation is   that the glass came into contact   with an unshielded power source.
That means a complete diagnostic   check of the Enterprise power   systems. All four thousand of   them.
Have I got the man for this job...       Hey, Reg...
Busy?
Well, I was just... no, not   really... what?
Got another mystery for you...   somehow the molecular structure   of this cup from Ten-Forward has   been altered...
Mister Barclay is the Sherlock   Holmes of the technical support   crew...
A fascinating vocation, Mister   Barclay. I am a student of   Sherlock Holmes mysteries and I   would enjoy discussing some of   your cases at your leisure.
My cases... ?
(to Barclay, indicating     glass)   Uh, Reg, we're gonna have to run   through the power systems, to see   if there's some kind of leak that   caused this.
I had to... I was going to do it   anyway...
You were?
To... to try and explain the   anti-grav unit failure... I still   can't... nothing about it makes   sense.
Then it is possible these two very   disparate incidents could be   related.
I wouldn't bother you with   something this minor, Commander...   but it may be a symptom of a more   serious problem...
You think we'll need to put in   to a starbase?
We'll have a better idea after   Mister Barclay runs a check of   the power systems...
It was Lieutenant Barclay who   first suggested the link between   the two incidents, sir.
No, it wasn't. Not really.
Will your investigation affect   our available power during the   mission, Lieutenant?
No... nossir... we'll have to shut   off some systems... they'll be   down a few at a time... it   shouldn't... I don't think so.
Good. I look forward to your   report, Mister Broccoli.
Barclay.
If you'll excuse me.
Metathesis is one of the most   common of pronunciation errors,   sir... a reversal of vowel and   consonant, "bark" to "broc"...
Yes, I know him... comes in here,   stands at the bar, doesn't say   much... always orders a warm milk.
Figures.
Warm milk helps you sleep, La   Forge. You should try it. What's   that got to do with Barclay?
I don't know. I'm just trying   to figure the man out, that's all.   You ever talk to him?
He's not much for talking.
Does he have any friends?
Not that I've seen.
What do you do with a guy like   that?
I give him his warm milk and let   him be.
Yeah, well, I'm not so lucky.   I can't let him be. He's my   problem.
He's imaginative.
How do you know that?
I just do.
Well, then maybe he's in the wrong   line of work.
You engineering types don't   appreciate imagination... ?
That's not it, Guinan... he just   doesn't fit in here...
Terkim.
What?
Reminds me of Terkim. My   mother's brother. A kind of   family misfit. Everybody told   me to stay away from him. Bad   influence.
Did you?

Are you kidding? He was the only   member of the family with a sense   of humor. But no one ever stayed   around him long enough to realize   it... except me. My mother says   I take after him. I probably do.   Because the idea of "fitting in"   repels me, too.
Maybe I didn't make myself   clear... Barclay, he's always   late... he's nervous... nobody   wants to be around him...
If I had the feeling that nobody   wanted to be around me, I'd   probably be late and nervous too.
Guinan, that's not the point...
Are you sure?
I'll take another one of these.
Get it yourself.
Computer, where is Lieutenant   Barclay?
Reg... ?
Beverly?
Good morning, Mi-lord.       Manners, my son. Manners. You   embarrass me before our guest.
Master Barclay will spank you if   you don't behave.
I don't care.
Wesley... ?
What do you want?
Ah, well, I guess I want... Master   Barclay.
The boys got into another little   scrap, I'm afraid. But boys will   be boys.
You cannot withstand our assault   forever, Barclay.
Say you will yield and it ends   here...
I will speak with my sword, sir...
Where in God's name did you learn   to fight like this, man?
Self-taught, my good capitaine.   Shall I give you a few lessons?
Who is that? One of your allies?
Jean-Luc. Not that old trick.   I'm disappointed in you.
I'll... I'll make it easy for you,   Commander. I'll just request   reassignment...
Now, wait a minute...
Look, we both know... the whole   ship knows... I can't cut it here.
Hey, Barclay... I've spent a few   hours in the Holodeck myself, you   know.
Far as I'm concerned... what you   do in the Holodeck is your own   business... as long as it doesn't   affect your work.
You're... you're not going to tell   anyone about this?
I'm not sure everyone would   appreciate your... imagination...   like I do.
It is kind of unusual...   recreating people you already   know...
I was just kind of really...   well, it was just... I needed to   blow off some steam... because   one... one of the officers had   been on my back...
Let me guess...
Okay, it was you. And I couldn't   tell you what I wanted to, to your   face... and it just sort of...   I guess it got out of control.
I don't know... sounds like maybe   there's a side to this that's kind   of therapeutic... we ought to tell   Counselor Troi about it.
It's... it's just more   comfortable... when I'm in there.       You don't know what a struggle   it is for me, Commander.
I'd like to help if I can.
(shakes his head, you     can't)   Being afraid all the time that   I'll forget somebody's name. Or   not knowing what to do with my   hands...

I mean, I'm the guy who writes   down things to remember to say   when there's a party. And when   I get there, I'll wind up alone   in a corner trying to look   comfortable examining a potted   plant.       Sometimes, I just don't want to   get out of bed in the morning.
Sometimes, neither do I.
No, but you're good. You were   born to be in Starfleet. Me...
You're just shy, Barclay.
"Just shy"... sounds like   nothing serious, doesn't it...   You can't know.
O'Brien to La Forge.
Go ahead.
I need you in Transporter Room   Three, Commander.
On my way, Chief.
I really do want you to talk to   Counselor Troi, Reg.
Troi? No, no, I couldn't.
I mean it. As your friend and   as your commanding officer.
I was synchronizing the phase   transition coils... I didn't do   anything I haven't done a hundred   times before...
The test object is made of pure   duranium.
Seems normal enough...
Watch this...
I'm glad I don't have anywhere   to go.         FADE OUT.                        END OF ACT TWO
Chief engineer's log, Stardate   43808.2. A systems analysis of   Transporter Room Three has yielded   no suggestion of a cause for the   latest malfunction aboard the   Enterprise.
Is this part of the same pattern?
We don't know, Captain. And we   don't know why only Transporter   Room Three is affected... None   of the other Transporter Rooms   are malfunctioning...
Yet.
We have twenty-two hours before   we reach Nahmi Four. We'll need   the transporters operational by   then. I want a level one   diagnostic across the board.
(acknowledges, to     Geordi)   Advise Mister Barclay to meet us   on the bridge immediately...
Ah, could we push that back, just   to fourteen hundred hours,   Commander... I've got him doing   something...
Fourteen hundred hours.       Mister O'Brien, no maintenance   on the Transporters until further   notice.
Aye, sir.
I can tell this is difficult for   you.
Is there anything I can do to make   you more comfortable?
No!
Have you ever been with a   counselor before?
Yes. No.
Which one?
Yes. But she... it wasn't real...   really a counselor.
Most people find a counselor   intimidating at first. It's okay   if you feel that way toward me.
Not... at all.
Good. Close your eyes... Lean   back.
Why?
I just want to help you relax.
You do?
Put your feet up... it's okay.   And close your eyes...
What are you going to do?
Just listen to the sound of my   voice...
Take a slow deep breath through   your nose... and let it out   through your mouth just as   slowly... good... there, that's   better, isn't it...
Oh, yes. Oh, yes, much better.   This has been... extremely   helpful...       Well, thank-you for your time.
But...
Really... very helpful... in   through the nose, out through the   mouth... I'll practice and let   you know... thank you again...
I had a very strange visit from   one of your officers today.
Barclay. Yes, I can imagine. Were you   able to do anything for him?
To be honest, I'm not exactly sure   what happened...
(entering from Picard's     Ready Room)   Where is Mister Barclay... it's   past fourteen hundred hours...
Lieutenant Barclay to the bridge.       Lieutenant Barclay report.
Computer. Locate Lieutenant   Barclay.
Lieutenant Barclay is in Holodeck   Two.
I'll get him...
No, I'll handle this. I've had   it with him.
Counselor, you better come   along...
I think you should know that   Barclay's been running some...   unique programs.
I don't care what he's been   running. My patience just ran   out.
Like I said Commander, Barclay's   been running some... unusual   programs.
This is a violation of protocol.   Crewmembers should not be   simulated in the Holodeck...
Ah, Commander... I don't think   there's any regulation...
Then there should be... computer,   discontinue program and erase...
Computer, belay that order!
Counselor...
If Barclay is having a difficult   time facing reality, to suddenly   destroy his only means of escape   would be brutal and could do   considerable damage.
They are quite disagreeable,   aren't they... shall we have a   go at them?
Delighted.
We shall thrash them.
En garde.
Stop it. Put that down.
Your sword, sir...
I don't have a sword.
How do expect to fight without   your sword?
I don't expect to fight.
Do I detect a streak of yellow   along the good fellow's back?
Perhaps we can supply a more   appropriate adversary for him.       Number One...
Number One...
Am I late? Did I miss the fight?
En garde...    (looks closely at Riker,     reacts)   Sir... you have a familiar   bearing... is it possible we have   crossed swords somewhere before?
Where is he? Where is Barclay?
Ah, a personal grudge. I warn   you... you would be wise to put   your affairs in final order before   you meet him in combat. You   challenge the greatest sword in   all the...
... in all the Holodeck.
You think this is funny?
You are very tall. It could be   very threatening to some people.
Barclay'll find out what it means   to be threatened. Computer,   discontinue image of Riker.
Sir, you have no sense of fair   play.
Just tell us where to find   Barclay.
You're gonna make us search   through this to find him?
It could provide us with valuable   information about what's troubling   him.
There's nothing wrong with a   healthy fantasy life, as long as   it doesn't take over.
You call this healthy?
You're taking it so seriously.   This is not without its element   of humor...
I am the Goddess of Empathy! Cast   off your inhibitions and embrace   love, truth, joy...
Oh my God...
Discard your facades and reveal   your true being to me.
Computer, discontinue --
Belay that order, computer!       We want to get more insight into   what's troubling the poor man.   Remember?       Quite a healthy fantasy life,   wouldn't you agree?
Report...
Sir, our velocity increased to   warp seven point two five.
Compensating, sir.
Confirmed. Velocity now warp   seven.
Maintain that. What the hell   happened?
The matter/anti-matter injectors   locked for a split second,   Captain. I am not certain why.   They seem to be working properly   now.
Picard to La Forge.
Go ahead, Captain.
Any explanation for the injector   problem?
I'm not in Engineering, sir. I'm   in Holodeck Two.
Another malfunction?
Not exactly, sir. I'll return   to Engineering immediately.
Yes, I would say you should,   Commander. Your Holodeck   activities can wait until later.   And Commander...
Yessir?
It would be wise to consult   Lieutenant Barclay on this latest   incident.
I'd like to, very much, sir. La   Forge out.         END INTERCUT:
We need to find Barclay. Now.
Cast aside your masks and let me   slip into your minds...
Muzzle it.
Shhhhh!
We have a lot to talk about.
Sir, Barclay and I better get   to Engineering.
Dismissed.
I just couldn't keep my eyes   open... I'd worked twelve hours   on the power systems and then the   transporter went down and...
Reg... you had a chance to get   some help from the real Counselor   Troi... but instead you went back   in there...
I know... I didn't want to... I   just couldn't help myself...
You're gonna be able to write the   book on holodiction.       Look, I know how easy it is to   get caught up in it. I... fell   in love in there once.
Really?
But I knew when it was time to   turn it off and say goodbye...   Wasn't easy. But I did it.
You know... the people I create   in there have started to become   more real to me... than anyone   out here.       Except maybe for you, Commander.
I need you out here, Reg... right   now, more than ever.
The injectors aren't responding   to the diagnostic commands.
I... think we should drop out of   warp.
La Forge to bridge.
Go ahead, Commander.
Recommend we go to impulse power   sir.
Take us out of warp.
Controls are not responding,   Captain.
It's the injectors.
Override.
It's not a computer problem. The   mechanism is physically jammed.       I can't clear it.
Speed increasing, Captain. Warp   seven point six... seven point   six five... seven point seven...
We can't shut it down, Captain.   The anti-matter flow is   increasing. She's accelerating   out of control.
Approaching warp nine sir...
Red Alert.
Data, estimated time to   structural failure.
At this rate of acceleration,   fifteen minutes, forty seconds,   Commander...
Geordi, did you copy?
Aye, Commander...
Recommendations.
I'll let you know as soon as we   have some. La Forge out.
Okay, this ship will start tearing   itself apart in fifteen minutes...   I want every idea on the table...   I don't care how outrageous...
What about attempting a magnetic   quench on the fusion pre-burners?
No, I tried that already... the   magnetic fields won't reset.
Could the fuel inlet servos be   caught in cycle?
If they were, the swirl dampers   would be frozen too... and they   aren't...
Nothing showed up in the   diagnostic sweep... at all?
The tests... uh, showed problems...   I mean no problems with the   flow... the flow of the...
There's nothing wrong with the   computer control protocols or the   power transfer systems. As far   as we can determine, the injectors   are just physically jammed...
Injectors freeze... antigrav unit   goes down... transporter   malfunctions...
And a twisted glass...
What's the connection?
Exceeding warp nine point four.
Begin evacuation of secondary   hull. Prepare for emergency   saucer separation.
Standing by to release docking   clamps.
Re-route systems to primary hull   power sources.
Captain, the plasma flow to the   nacelles is uneven due to the   injector lock. An emergency   saucer separation could rupture   the warp field.
Twelve minutes to structural   failure.
None of the systems involved   interact directly with each   other... I don't see anything in   common...
What if... what if...       what if one of us is the   connection?
Us? How?

I don't know. But we're looking   for... a, a systemic explanation   and there isn't one. We work with   all the systems that are affected   ... what if we're transmitting   something ourselves... by touching   it, or something...
The computer sensors would've   picked up anything dangerous.
But... if it were something...   something that we couldn't scan...       You might've passed it to the   injectors when you were realigning   the magnetic capacitors.
It was your glass, Duffy... and   both of you were in the cargo bay   when the anti-grav failed...
So was O'Brien.
The transporter malfunction.   That's a connection too.
Danger. Approaching safety   limits of engine containment   field.
Computer, list all physical   substances that wouldn't normally   be picked up by internal scans.
There are fifteen thousand five   hundred twenty-five known   substances that cannot be   detected by standard scans.
Great. How many of those can   exist in an oxygen atmosphere?
Five hundred thirty-two.
And could alter molecular   structure when it comes in   contact with...       ... with glass.
Five.
(touches pool table     button)   On screen at this station.
Jakmanite has a half life of about   fifteen seconds. There wouldn't   be enough time to spread it around   the ship.
Right.
Selgninaem and Lucrovexitrin are   extremely toxic.
(acknowledges, touches     panel again)   We'd all be dead by now. That   leaves Saltzgadum and Invidium.   Neither of which has been used   for decades.
Could either one be causing all   these malfunctions?
Most of the affected systems   weren't even invented when those   substances were in use. Who knows   what they could do to a   transporter or a magnetic   capacitor... ?
Wasn't Invidium used in...   medical containment fields?
Not for over a century.
But the Mikulaks might still be   using it.
And one of those canisters was   broken.
La Forge to bridge. We have a   working theory, Captain...
There's a chance we picked up some   Invidium from a broken canister   in the cargo bay... and have been   spreading it around the ship...
Working theories are fine, Geordi.   But we need a working solution   in about five minutes...
Understood, Commander. We're on   our way to Cargo Bay Five for   confirmation.
Nothing from the tricorder...
Danger. Exceeding safety limits   of engine containment field. At   current acceleration, structural   failure will occur in three   minutes, thirty seconds.
There it is...
Duffy and O'Brien picked up the   broken canister and became   contaminated..
If we can get it... the   invidium... down to minus two   hundred degrees Celsius, it'll   become inert.
La Forge to bridge. Invidium is   confirmed.
Recommend we flood the injector   pathway conduit with liquid   nitrogen. That should neutralize   it.
The question is, will the   injectors come back on-line?
The injectors have sustained   considerable damage, sir. I   can't guarantee we'll be able to   regain control...
We don't have much choice, do we?
Nossir.
Make it so.
Route primary coupling through   starboard transfer conduit.
Routing... ready for engine core   injection.
At current acceleration,   structural failure will occur in   forty-five seconds.
Injector conduit temperature   minus one hundred degrees   Celsius.
Transfer injector control to   manual.
Ready... temperature now minus   one hundred ninety degrees...   minus two hundred degrees, sir.
Injector status?
Matter injector... is on-line.   Anti-matter injector... still   locked.
At current acceleration,   structural failure will occur in   thirty seconds.
Cycle power through ventral   relay.
Anti-matter injector... on-line.   Reducing flow capacity.   Commencing warp engine shut-down.
Stand down from Red Alert.
Nice work, Geordi.
Mister Barclay and I thank you,   sir.
Acknowledged.
The ship is seriously   contaminated with Invidium, sir.   Recommend we set course for   Starbase one-two-one for a   complete systems and   bio-decontamination.
Understood.
Glad you were with us out here   in the real world today, Mister   Barclay.

It has been most difficult to   reach this decision to leave   you... but after thinking it   over, discussing it at length with   Counselor Troi... I think it is   for the best... I just wanted to   thank you all for your support...
You'll always be welcome here,   Barclay.
I know. That's what makes it hard   to go.
It was a pleasure to serve with   you, Mister Barclay.
Good luck, Reg.
It's been fun.       Computer, end program.
Erase all programs filed under   Reginald Barclay.
Except... Program Nine...
